davisusanibar commented on pull request #11986:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11986#issuecomment-996822968


   Hi Team
   
   Log4J 2.x {15,16} are discovering more vector attacks.
   
   Log4J 2.x is not mandatory and needed by arrow-performance. I delete that dependency and compile and execute the code and it is worked as expected
   
   Please let me know if we could move with delete than dependency as suggested at https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11966


--

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
2.0 <= Apache log4j2 <= 2.14.1 have a RCE zero day.

[https://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/security.html]

[https://www.cyberkendra.com/2021/12/worst-log4j-rce-zeroday-dropped-on.html]

[https://www.lunasec.io/docs/blog/log4j-zero-day/]
fields.summary: [Java] Remove log4j2 dependency in performance module

comments.body: [~ana4] Thanks for reporting the problem. It should be fixed ASAP.

Hi Team

Log4J 2.x \{15,16} are discovering more vector attacks.

Log4J 2.x is not mandatory and needed by arrow-performance. I delete that dependency and compile and execute the code and it is worked as expected

Please [~fan_li_ya]  / [~ana4]  let me know if we could move with delete than dependency as suggested at [https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11966]
This is the [POC|https://github.com/davisusanibar/cve-log/blob/cve-java-arrow-performance/Readme.md#arrow-java-modules] that show us vector attack execution using arrow-performance
[~dsusanibara] Thanks for the good point. PR updated, please check.
